definitions.definition: that must be done because of a law or a rule
definitions.sensetop: it is compulsory (for somebody/something) to do something

examples.text: English is a **compulsory subject** at this level.
The strikers are protesting against the threat of compulsory redundancies.
It is compulsory for all motorcyclists to wear helmets.
examples.contextForm: it is compulsory (for somebody/something) to do something

wordOrigin: early 16th cent. (as a noun denoting a legal mandate which had to be obeyed): from medieval Latin compulsorius, from compuls- ‘driven, forced’, from the verb compellere, from com- ‘together’ + pellere ‘drive’.
